intro: Pinalia mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
